results.title: The Merchant of Venice
results.creator_credit: BBC, Time-Life Films, Jonathon Miller and Jack Gold
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “BBC Television Shakespeare Series”.
Antonio, a merchant of Venice, borrows money from the Jewish moneylender, Shylock, on behalf of his friend Bassanio, so that he may travel to Belmont to woo the wealthy Portia. A stipulation of this loan is that it must be repaid in full within three months, or Shylock will have a pound of the merchant’s flesh in lieu. About to wed Portia, Bassanio learns that the ships from which Antonio would have obtained the money to repay Shylock have been lost and that the usurer is demanding his pound of flesh. Bassanio returns to Venice to help his friend. Portia, without her husband knowing of her intentions, seeks legal advice, and appears at the trial disguised as a lawyer. Featuring Warren Mitchell as Shylock, Gemma Jones as Portia.

results.title: The Merchant of Venice
results.creator_credit: Associated Television, Cecil Clarke and John Sichel
results.brief_description: Laurence Olivier and Joan Plowright head the cast of The National Theatre Company’s presentation of Jonathan Miller’s brilliant stage production of the Merchant of Venice. This particular Shakespeare production is set in Venice in the 1880’s and includes a musical score by Carl Davies. The focus is on the central character of Shylock, the Jew, played powerfully and unusually sympathetically by Laurence Olivier. The story involves a young Venetian Antonio (Anthony Nichols) who borrows money from Shylock on the security of a pound of flesh. On default of his bond a trial takes place and the heroine Portia (Joan Plowright) pleads in Antonio’s defence. Whilst the romantic comedy aspects of the play are retained, there is a heightened sense of drama throughout this production with the trial scene making a forceful climax. The cast also includes Jeremy Brett as Bassanio and Michael Jayston as Gratiano.

results.title: The Merchant of four seasons
results.brief_description: Set in the 1950s this film is based directly on a memory from Fassbinder’s youth. An uncle trying to reenter civilian life after serving in the German army set up in business as a fruit and vegetable vendor, other members of the family not only failed to support him but seemed deliberately to put obstacles in his path. Fassbinder turned this recollection of domestic discord into an unsparing critique of selfishness, snobbery and ad inhumanity in a ‘typical’ German middle-class family.

results.title: The Mental hospital volunteer: someone who cares
results.brief_description: Depicts the role and influence of the mental hospital volunteer in the lives of hospitalised mental patients. Describes some of the undesirable conditions in mental hospitals, the needs of mental patients, the varied activities of a volunteer program, and the process of orienting and training new volunteers.

results.title: The Men in the park
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Robert Verrall and George Geertsen
results.brief_description: These men in the park are pencil drawings, but this is no still-life study. Here the figures move; facial expressions change; a figure of a man rises and shambles off the scene; a bus flashes past in the nearby blur of traffic, and in the background are all the blatant, hurrying sounds of the city. It is as if the artist’s sketchbook has become animate, alive. The result is intriguing, especially for those with an eye for the art of film animation.

results.title: The Men
results.creator_credit: Stanley Kramer Productions, Stanley Kramer and Fred Zimmerman
results.brief_description: Marlon Brando stars as a G.I., made a paraplegic in combat during WWII. Returning home to face the torturous ordeal of rehabilitation, the courage and strength of the soldier are now betrayed by the fear and insecurity of the man who learns he will never walk again. It is the courage and determination of his fiance, Ellen (Theresa Wright), who, fighting his bitterness, social prejudices and the wishes of her parents, forces him to confront the reality of his condition and come to accept the reality of his disability. In characteristic style Brando prepared for his role by actually living with paraplegics in an effort to better understand their problems and challenges.

results.title: The Memphis belle: the story of a flying fortress
results.creator_credit: United States. War Dept. and William Wyler
results.brief_description: The story of the B-17 bomber Memphis Belle on its final mission over Germany to bomb the submarine pens at Wilhelmshaven as told by William Wyler. Shows the 8th Bomber Command air crews being briefed and ground crew preparations. Contains rare wartime footage of actual combat conditions.

results.title: The Meldrum Tapes: Best Of
results.brief_description: The program “The Meldrum Tapes” has given Australian audiences an opportunity to see another side of their favourite performers, in informal discussions, with Ian “Molly” Meldrum. This video shows Molly talking to the Rolling Stones, Genesis, Madonna, Elton John, Bob Geldof, Icehouse, The Models, Sting, Billy Joel, Cyndi Lauper and the Eurythmics.

results.title: The Melbourne Juvenile Justice Centre
results.brief_description: The Melbourne Juvenile Justice Centre was opened in December 1993 and replaced the outdated and inadequate Turana Youth Training Centre. It introduced a new approach to accomodating and rehabilitating young offenders completing sentences from the Victorian Court. This program shows efforts to break the circuit of offending by Client Service Planning and a strong emphasis on educational and vocational programs.

results.title: The Melbourne Games
results.creator_credit: Golden Years, Video Sports, James Murray and Denis Phelan
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Olympic glory: the golden years”.
Live through the unforgettable action for the first time the Olympic Flame blazed in the Southern Hemisphere. This program captures the momentous highs and lows Australians were able to savour first hand. It includes footage of the remarkable first, second and third places captured by Australian swimmers in the women’s 100m final, headed by the fabulous Dawn Fraser. The explosive confrontation between Hungarian and Russian water polo teams, less than three weeks after the Russian invasion. The pride of Betty Cuthbert’s glorious wins in the 100m, 200m and 4 x 100m relay races. Plus all the local magic of a youthful nation hosting the world’s premiere sporting competition. Narrated by Norman May.
